pr_title: [ISSUE #672] Add SupportsNamespaces on HiveCatalog and HadoopCatalog

timeline.message:
[ISSUE #672] Add SupportsNamespaces on HiveCatalog and HadoopCatalog

[ISSUE #672] Add SupportsNamespaces on HiveCatalog and HadoopCatalog

[ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Jerryshao

[ISSUE #672] Add the empty namespace check in nameSpaceToHiveDb

[ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Ryan Blue

[ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Ryan Blue

[ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Ryan Blue

[ISSUE #672] Fix RuntimeException to RuntimeIOException

timeline.bodyText:
Do you think there will be changes to a namespace other than setting properties and removing properties?
It may be much simpler to use setProperties(Namespace, Map<String, String>) and removeProperties(Namespace, Set<String>) instead of this and the NamespaceChange classes. What do you think?
timeline.author: rdblue
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,114 @@ +/* + * Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one + * or more contributor license agreements. See the NOTICE file + * distributed with this work for additional information + * regarding copyright ownership. The ASF licenses this file + * to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the + * "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance + * with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at + * + * http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 + * + * Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, + * software distributed under the License is distributed on an + * "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY + * KIND, either express or implied. See the License for the + * specific language governing permissions and limitations + * under the License. + */ + +package org.apache.iceberg.catalog; + +import com.google.common.collect.ImmutableMap; +import java.util.List; +import java.util.Map; +import org.apache.iceberg.exceptions.AlreadyExistsException; +import org.apache.iceberg.exceptions.NoSuchNamespaceException; + +/** + * Catalog methods for working with namespaces. + *

+ * If an object such as a table, view, or function exists, its parent namespaces must also exist + * and must be returned by the discovery methods {@link #listNamespaces()} and + * {@link #listNamespaces(Namespace namespace)}. + *

+ * Catalog implementations are not required to maintain the existence of namespaces independent of + * objects in a namespace. For example, a function catalog that loads functions using reflection + * and uses Java packages as namespaces is not required to support the methods to create, alter, or + * drop a namespace. Implementations are allowed to discover the existence of objects or namespaces + * without throwing {@link NoSuchNamespaceException} when no namespace is found. + */ +public interface SupportsNamespaces { + /** + * Create a namespace in the catalog. + * + * @param namespace {@link Namespace}. + * @throws AlreadyExistsException If the namespace already exists + * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If create is not a supported operation + */ + default void createNamespace(Namespace namespace) { + createNamespace(namespace, ImmutableMap.of()); + } + + /** + * Create a namespace in the catalog. + * + * @param namespace a multi-part namespace + * @param metadata a string ImmutableMap of properties for the given namespace + * @throws AlreadyExistsException If the namespace already exists + * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If create is not a supported operation + */ + void createNamespace(Namespace namespace, ImmutableMap metadata); + + /** + * List top-level namespaces from the catalog. + *

+ * If an object such as a table, view, or function exists, its parent namespaces must also exist + * and must be returned by this discovery method. For example, if table a.b.t exists, this method + * must return ["a"] in the result array. + * + * @return an List of namespace {@link Namespace} names + */ + default List listNamespaces() { + return listNamespaces(Namespace.empty()); + } + + /** + * List namespaces from the namespace. + *

+ * For example, if table a.b.t exists, use 'SELECT NAMESPACE IN a' this method + * must return Namepace.of("a","b") {@link Namespace}. + * + * @return an List of namespace {@link Namespace} names + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + */ + List listNamespaces(Namespace namespace) throws NoSuchNamespaceException; + + /** + * Load metadata properties for a namespace. + * + * @param namespace a Namespace.of(name) {@link Namespace} + * @return a string map of properties for the given namespace + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + */ + Map loadNamespaceMetadata(Namespace namespace) throws NoSuchNamespaceException; + + /** + * Drop namespace, while the namespace haven't table or sub namespace will return true. + * + * @param namespace a Namespace.of(name) {@link Namespace} + * @return true while drop success. + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + */ + boolean dropNamespace(Namespace namespace) throws NoSuchNamespaceException; + + /** + * Apply a set of metadata changes to a namespace in the catalog. + * + * @param namespace a Namespace.of(name) {@link Namespace} + * @param changes a collection of changes to apply to the namespace + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If namespace properties are not supported + */ + boolean alterNamespace(Namespace namespace, NamespaceChange... changes) throws NoSuchNamespaceException;

replies.bodyText: I think that not only change the setting properties, the namespace also support to changes, like that  alterNamespace(oldNamespace,  {"name" : newNameSpace})
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText: Renames would use a rename method, not a SetProperty change.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: OK I have implement the setProperties and removeProperties methods
replies.author: XiaokunDing

timeline.bodyText: This should use Map and not ImmutableMap. We don't want to leak Guava classes through this API.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This shouldn't use the outer SLASH.join. Instead, use the new Path(String, String) constructor.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Please fix path construction here and other places that need it as well.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This can be moved outside of the try block.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This file system should always be the same one. Can you add a final instance field for it using the warehouse path instead of calling getFs in each method?
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: There should be a newline between method definitions.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText:
Is this used elsewhere, or can it be private?
Also, please move this static helper after instance methods.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: What about an exists method? Is that something we should implement?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: OK I am implement an exists method
replies.author: XiaokunDing

timeline.bodyText: This violates the method contract. This should return false because the namespace did not exist.
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: I think maybe throw an exception is better than return false. If only return a false at here, user could not know why there is false while drop a namespace.
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText: No, this should return false to signal that the namespace didn't exist. The method always succeeds to make it idempotent.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Why does this cascade, but not delete data? Can you explain these options?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: OK I fixed it, delete data together at here, I was think delete data is a danger operation.
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText: Can you explain what all 3 options do? I'm not sure that this should cascade using Hive. If we are going to delete all tables, then this should probably be implemented in Iceberg so that we remove files that aren't in the table root.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText:
deleteData delete the underlying data or just delete the table in metadata store, we only delete the metadata from meta store, so deleteData is false.
cascade is true,  while drop the database, this will drop the table of the database one by one, before drop the database. @rdblue would you means we should set cascade false if we  have not implement the iceberg table removed?
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText:
I think we need to decide what the semantics are for dropNamespace. There are a few options:

dropNamespace could check that the namespace is empty and throw a NamespaceNotEmptyException if it is not.
dropNamespace could recursively delete, which I think is what cascade would do
dropNamespace could have a cascade flag to recursively delete

I think the easiest option to get this PR in is to go with Option 1. We can always add a cascade flag later to go switch to Option 3. And that way we don't have to worry about Hive behaviors and how to correctly clean up tables right now.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: OK thanks @rdblue I have implement the dropNamespace method like Option 1.
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText: Thank you! It looks much better. Just a few more comments.
replies.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: This is duplicated in a few places and can be refactored into a helper method, validateNamespace.
timeline.author: rdblue

Implementations are allowed to discover the existence of objects or namespaces + * without throwing {@link NoSuchNamespaceException} when no namespace is found. + */ +public interface SupportsNamespaces { + /** + * Create a namespace in the catalog. + * + * @param namespace {@link Namespace}. + * @throws AlreadyExistsException If the namespace already exists + * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If create is not a supported operation + */ + default void createNamespace(Namespace namespace) { + createNamespace(namespace, ImmutableMap.of()); + } + + /** + * Create a namespace in the catalog. + * + * @param namespace a multi-part namespace + * @param metadata a string Map of properties for the given namespace + * @throws AlreadyExistsException If the namespace already exists + * @throws UnsupportedOperationException If create is not a supported operation + */ + void createNamespace(Namespace namespace, Map metadata); + + /** + * List top-level namespaces from the catalog. + *

+ * If an object such as a table, view, or function exists, its parent namespaces must also exist + * and must be returned by this discovery method. For example, if table a.b.t exists, this method + * must return ["a"] in the result array. + * + * @return an List of namespace {@link Namespace} names + */ + default List listNamespaces() { + return listNamespaces(Namespace.empty()); + } + + /** + * List namespaces from the namespace. + *

+ * For example, if table a.b.t exists, use 'SELECT NAMESPACE IN a' this method + * must return Namepace.of("a","b") {@link Namespace}. + * + * @return an List of namespace {@link Namespace} names + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + */ + List listNamespaces(Namespace namespace) throws NoSuchNamespaceException; + + /** + * Load metadata properties for a namespace. + * + * @param namespace a Namespace.of(name) {@link Namespace} + * @return a string map of properties for the given namespace + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional) + */ + Map loadNamespaceMetadata(Namespace namespace) throws NoSuchNamespaceException; + + /** + * Drop namespace, while the namespace haven't table or sub namespace will return true. + * + * @param namespace a Namespace.of(name) {@link Namespace} + * @return true while drop success. + * @throws NoSuchNamespaceException If the namespace does not exist (optional)

timeline.bodyText: Why must the namespace be non-empty?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Because in Hive, the namespace is only one level, so namespace have not sub namespace.  the sentence like that show subNamespace from namespace we should return an empty list not throw an error.
replies.author: XiaokunDing

timeline.message: [ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Ryan Blue
[ISSUE #672] Fix the code address comments by Ryan Blue

timeline.bodyText:
I don't understand what this is trying to say. I think it should be this:

Drop a namespace. If the namespace exists and was dropped, this will return true.

Is this a recursive operation? That is, if the namespace is not empty (has child namespaces or tables) will those also be dropped?

timeline.bodyText:
Why is this optional?
This method should have a clear contract. Maybe deleting nested tables and maybe not deleting them is not reliable enough behavior.

timeline.bodyText: What is meant by "error" in this context message?

timeline.bodyText: What is meant by "error" in this context message? The other messages describe the expectation that the assertion validates; the one above is an example of a good one: "should fail to drop namespace if it is not empty". Could you rephrase this to be similar?

timeline.bodyText: This needs a space after "empty" or else the namespace will not be separated.
timeline.author: rdblue

timeline.bodyText: Why is this protected?
timeline.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: Because this method only used in hive, so I think protected is better.
replies.author: XiaokunDing

replies.bodyText: Should it be private? If it is used in tests, we would normally make it package-private.
replies.author: rdblue

replies.bodyText: OK, it should a package-private, thank you for your patience
replies.author: XiaokunDing
